content: I'm trying to log some jira aginst the SMRT web messaging ballot, but the url I have has "uv" in the path, and Jira doesn't like that
I don't see a version index... so I'm not sure how to make this work/how to get to the "real" or acceptable URL that resolves :)
I'm cheating by putting in the URL (that won't resolve) for jira, with the "real" in comments... but I feel like I have to be missing something :D
@Lloyd McKenzie do you have any insight on the Jira config for SMART Web Messaging?
(I actually just had the same issue logging against US-Core! In my case it was PEBKAC, I had an old URL)

@Josh Mandel The 'url' for the SMART web messaging specification in Jira-Spec-Artifacts is wrong - it says it's http://hl7.org/fhir/smart-web-messaging, but it looks like it should be http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/smart-web-messaging. You can submit a pull request or I can force a change - let me know your preference.
If you can fix this directly that would be ideal. Fyi @Carl Anderson
Done - should propagate through Jira's cache in about 5 minutes.
Huh, I must have been clobbered at some point.
I fixed this a couple weeks ago, I thought.
Oh, I see. The wrong part is the extra 2020Sep at the end?
Nevermind - totally different field. I see what happened now. Thanks for fixing this, Lloyd.
The ballot URLs aren't actually used at the moment
